place_description: Supermarket chain dedicated to health-conscious foods like organic produce & grass-fed beef.

reviews_data.review_text: ROACHES!!!! ROACHES IN THE BATHROOMS AND IN THE OLIVE BAR FLOATING! DISGUSTING! STORE MANAGER IS CLUELESS! And don't care!
Always a pleasure shopping there.

I had an amazing experience at the bakery with Sarah.  She made a delicious chocolate cake for my niece's baby shower.  There wasn't a bite left even though everyone wanted seconds.  Next time I'll order two!! Thanks Sarah!!

I love Earth Fare! I love going here for all of my healthy goodies. I especially love Sarah in the bakery. She is so helpful and nice. Oh, and her Challah is absolutely amazing!! Highly recommend if you haven't tried it yet. The cinnamon is my favorite!
Store went through a remodel and looks great! The meat and bakery department looked fresh and full.
This store has been re arranged  looks good

This is my goto store for milk and chicken.
The glass bottle milk are too good for the price. It is the best milk with no preservatives and super fresh. The chicken at counter are so fresh and tastes so yummy.
Picked up a trey of pastries for an event on Tuesday. They were amazing along with their staff. Sara was awesome in the bakery dept.

I have loved the store and have shopped there weekly for years. Since my neighborhood Earthfare closed a couple of years ago, I drive 25 minutes to go to the Ballantyne store
Went today at 2 pm for daily special chicken and chuck for 3.99. They were out of the chicken and the chuck was going to be 25 minute wait for 2 lbs. The clerk said people came in early and bought all the chicken and lots of individual chuck lbs. I asked for a raincheck but was told they can't do that. Manager would not even come out to tell me personally, instead sending message via cashier. I'm extremely disappointed after driving all this way for  NOTHING. There should be a limit to the amount one person can buy to allow the deals to extend to others. I also saw a very elderly man hobble all the way in the store only to be told the same thing. Sad watching him leave empty handed as well. Earthfare...you can manage better than that.

I've been going to this earth fair for around 15 years. After today's experience in the meat counter, I will never step foot in the store again. I was cursed at and almost assaulted by the butcher. Earthfare really needs to do a better job on who they hire. What happened to me today will have closure Very soon
Guy working in the butchery is very rude

Bought these on 4/20/2024
Their 'Best By' date was 08/07/2023

Earth Fare is a great store. It is pricy but for certain items, it is well worth the price. The meat department is excellent as is the produce department. The number of organic items is unparalleled. The store has some type of special daily. The specials are usually a percentage of in an entire department or $ x off if you spend $y.  We do not do our basic grocery shopping there, but we go about once a week for items we only purchase there. They also have a very nice selection of prepared foods.
Employees are exhausted, probably underpaid, definitely demotivated. Respectful, but no talking above the bare minimum. Store clean, looks like there was a major leak.
Healthy

The place is easy to get to and is very clean.  Majority of the staff  pretty much ignores you.  We were at the smoothie and sandwich area and the young gentleman had earbuds in and grilling something and once he looked at us but never acknowledged us or asked if we needed help.

Joan, who checked us out, was amazing!!!!!  She was friendly and helpful!!!  She gets 10 our of 10 stars!!!!!

Earth Fare in Concord,  the staff is friendlier!!!!

Great selection of foods that are difficult to find anywhere else nearby, especially for folks with food allergies. For the most part, we enjoyed coming here. However, we're from out of town and where we live, there is no Earth Fare. Last time we were here, the attendant at the smoothie bar made us some delicious fresh drinks and made fun conversation with us. That really elevated our experience at the store. This time, we encountered two young men who smelled like 'grass' and spent most of their time either picking food from the hot bar for themselves, sat down in the guest area, or on their phones outside. They didn't care to answer any questions pertaining to the smoothie offerings and even told us the bar was closed to get rid of us. This is an opportunity to be more conscious about hiring and/or training your employees, Earth Fare. Your employees generally don't give the impression that they want to be there, so why should we want to? This is not how you get people to come back. Otherwise, prices are pretty high, but it's a fine store.
My favorite place
Great store. Well stocked. Very friendly employees. Though they are high they are cheaper than Sprouts and not too much higher than Harris Teeter. I would recommend.

I always have the Best experiences with your Bakery department. I order all my cakes & treats from there. Everything I've tried was just amazing & especially working with Sarah. She always gives good suggestions, Super friendly & has all my ordered on time, made perfectly. I tell everyone to go see her. I'll be back soon....
this store needs a self-check out kiosk. takes waaaaay to long with just one cashier and when only getting a few items

good produce markdowns and meat markdowns
wish i can go there frequently to shop just to far away
Produce section was very disappointing, not good quality.
Great stuff!  A cut above other chains. Prices are a little higher, but they'll have what you need.

I used to be a loyal customer before they shutdown. I have been coming to this location ever since the beginning of January 2022. The store wasn't in the best condition, but I understand due to the short-staffing.
I came back into the store to give them one more shot, & man is it a night & day difference! The grocery isle looked fully-stocked (the best it has looked in months) & the customer service experience was a lot better (not Chick-Fil-A level, but who can compare to them).
I was looking for one of my southern favorites, Pimento cheese! However, they didn't have it at the time I was shopping. Instead, I opted to try the veggie wrap & I was surprised on how fresh the ingredients were. The cucumbers were crisp, & the hummus had an unexpected smokiness to it. Now it is one of my go-to's whenever I go to Earth Fare.
Overall, the whole experience was a large step up from when I visited back in early 2022. I would recommend to everyone, to give this place a shot.
Good food
I was racially profiled at this store the people that work here hate people of color.

No wonder most of their stores are going out of business. Hope they get replaced by a HT or Publix sometime soon.

I went there from work to grab lunch for the first time. While the presentation at the kitchen was good, every item I picked from the food options was absolute trash. God knows how many days old the cooked rice was- half of the rice got was as hard as frozen rice. I bought a pizza slice which was hard as a brick. The el pastor meat and the chorizo were tasteless, and very cold. I just felt sorry for myself.

Excellent prices for high quality specialty items, much more like a health food store than some generic grocery store.  Perfect for vegetarians and people with other special diets - I have never seen so many gluten free options anywhere! I love all the baked goods, always fresh and delicious. Friendly atmosphere and staff.

We love this store, it's our go to place to get water and the occasional dessert on sale. Today is the last day I'll get any dessert from there. Found a giant hair inside the strawberry shortcake slice. Not sure if they are made in store but seriously, not what I expected from this place.
Not impressed. Used to love this store.

Definitely worth the visit if you're on an intentional health journey. The store is clean and well maintained. They have a variety of healthy options to choose from. Be advised that your health is an investment.

The only Earth Fare left in Charlotte! The store is well maintained and stocked. Lots of vegan, organic, and dairy free items. Prices are higher than your normal grocery store but it's better quality. The hot bar is definitely recommended during lunch time.
It's not what it use to be years ago. But I still like it.
Very good super market to get organic food and fresh fruit and veggies

Such a great experience every time I shop here. Sarah in the bakery is amazing. Super friendly and always there to answer any questions. Sarah helped me surprise my husband with some amazing chocolate covered strawberries! And have gotten some great cakes! Definitely go see Sarah in the bakery!
Love this store....
Prices are reasonable and a MUCH better store than Whole Foods. This location has the best bakery in town!
You can definitely see the work put into the building lately! super clean and lots of lovely people! if you haven't been in a while you should definitely give it another try!
Amazing staff!!
Today everything on yogurt, babagandus etc were expired. Someone needs to take care of them

I really want this store to be good. It's very close to my home. But the pricing is absolutely ridiculous. I understand charging a premium for premium products but the basics should be competitive (or at least in the same ballpark). I would likely pay up for the bougie products while I buy my standard pantry staples but I find most of my usual products are double price or near double for a smaller portion. This operation has gone under once before and I expect the same with this insane pricing model. Sad.

Finally, when bringing this up to management (maybe? Only 2 employees could be found) I was informed that the $6 coffee creamer was $10 in Connecticut, so I guess I should be happy?

The store is clean I will say that. But it is ghost town. No one at the customer service  desk, and no one at all in the entire deli and bakery area. Self serve coffee is luke warm and no creamer or milk at all. But there is no one you can even ask!    A customer in front of me asked the cashier "are you all open on Sunday" and he said "I have no idea" and continued on. For such an expensive store, seems like quality would be better.
Really impressed by the new design,  love it . Have everything I need, lots of healthy items, definitely will come back soon

So much good food and choices, but it's a shame there are no employees to help you! Shopped on a Saturday early evening, literally two employees on the floor and one was a cashier. Had to go track someone down to help me in the meat department. Always a frustrating experience, I don't know why I keep coming. I work near the Fort Mill location and it is fully staffed and has excellent customer service. Worth the drive if you live in the Ballantyne area.
Excellent tried and true health foods small chain store...I only wish there were more.
Good stuff here for a fare price, usually organic stores are very expensive but this store is only moderately expensive. They do have a good selection of foods and drinks as well as a great deli!
Sad to say permanently closed
$5 sushi Wednesday is awesome! So good.
I sorta come here every day!!! Love the staff and convenience
Fantastic selection and very friendly and helpful staff. Thank you

Working out of town and thought I'd stop in for a quick salad from the salad bar. My feelings were hurt as they ONLY had lettuce, tomato, mushrooms, onions and brocolli for the whole salad bar. Also some Italian wedding soup but i wanted salad so that didnt work. Thanks but no thanks.
Love to shop groceries here I was really upset when this was closed. Really happy now.
The employees here are super  helpful and prices are reasonable. Particularly, their butcher, Ethan is great.
Prices are higher than some other places, but comparable to Whole Foods. They sometimes have really good meat prices.
Great customer service, especially in the deli.  Wonderful atmosphere.  Very clean and spacious.
Picked up some great steaks at Balyntine location
Smaller store and less merchandise. Very disappointed.

I would have shopped more but I couldn't finagle around all the unmasked customers.  As someone with a lowered immune system,  I DID NOT FEEL COMFORTABLE SHOPPING IN THIS STORE.  Won't be back. And this store is minimally staffed.

I don't usually post my experiences unless it's absolutely phenomenal  or absolutely atrocious. Well today, my experience with Patrick from the meat dept was absolutely phenomenal. He went out his  way to cut certain portions of the poultry I wanted and had it ready when I got there. Unfortunately it was a miscommunication and I was extremely apologetic and his words were, " Do I seemed disappointed" He prepared what I needed as we chatted about 10 minutes on the shortages. If the Earth Fare in South Park was still open, as a customer for 9 years, I would have left to drive an additional 8 miles to make this Earth Fare my new home. Thank you Patrick! You're the Man!!!
Wow. Do yourself a favor and go to Whole Foods instead.  I won't be going back to this Earth Fare.

New in the area and young lady reiterated that we look like we Insta-cart shopping. Word of advice for customer service never judge who is shopping , & keep it professional. Unacceptable remarks from employee.
Their roasted chickens are only $5 on Mondays! Delicious!

Worst customer experience I've ever had in my entire life. After an employee pretending to be a manager, then the manager calling the next day and telling me that the big infested produce I received was my essentially my fault for buying organic, I will never shop here again. Unbelievably awful experience. This store was great pre-COVID. This new ownership clearly doesn't vet their employees.
I have been shopping at Earthfare for years. I was so excited to know they had repopened. Earthfare has great customer service!
The "new" store is so nice, more open space. Staff was super nice and helpful. Glad to see some of the past employees come back after it closed. Will be back.
This is now closed

Announced yesterday that all stores closing. Very poorly handled. Nothing on website, outside or inside store about closing. No signs saying how much discount there is, you just have to wait until you get your receipt. I planned on going there this morning anyway and didn't buy much more than I planned on. I feel sorry for the employees.

I went to pick up some pizza during lunchtime appropriately 1230pm and the hot food server had put the self serve pizza out. He failed to cut the pizza, and put out utensils for customers to cut their slice and go; as intended.
I asked the very kinda server that was over the sushi station for assistance. He alerted the young man and he never came to cut the pizza and put the utensils out.
I waited while he finished up with a customer and went on to say I'll take the next person. Well we were the next customer.... he said we needed to wait as he shouted for the next customer. The man behind us was confused especially since he knew we were there first. As myself and 3 other customers at this point were waiting for self serve pizza.
I've very disappointed with this interaction as I typically come to Earthfare. This is not the type of customer service we should be given. There are other places during my lunchtime in the area I can spend my money at.
I do not want to give money to a company who's vision does not understand the importance of customer service and how consumers spend their time during their work day.

Update: Thomas the store manager called almost immediately and made this right! He apologized for the service inconvenience and was very receptive. Thomas is an asset to Earthfare and a great team member of management! Thanks again for your great customer service Thomas!
Always a disappointment at Earth Fare. The grocery store that could be but has the worst employees and management.

This store seems like it's being minimally maintained. It is dirty in and around areas that customers are absolutely going to notice it. The self serve food and coffee counters are disgusting. You should not have to grimace to touch anything in those areas... especially first thing in the morning when all these areas should be 100% freshly cleaned & fully serviced. It was 7:50am when I walked in for a cup of coffee. There was very little half and half in the metal serving container + it looks worse for the wear. I am really shocked about the state of this store.

I was here yesterday. I stopped for the roasted chicken, which is delicious. The reason for the bad review is the check out process. They have the slowest, most disorganized cashiers ever. This is twice I have been here and twice that it took 20 minutes to check out. I was third in line and no one had very much. Talon, the cashier, comes across as hating her job. The other cashier, who had override capability, had no idea how to ring up bulk food products. I realized that the manager of this store does not read google reviews. So I am sure nothing will be done to correct this. So, if I am going to be overcharged for organic groceries, I will go to Whole Foods. At least their cashiers smile and check you out quickly.

This was my first...and last...time here. I came for a specific item that they carry that other stores don't and also thought I'd pick up a few "sale" items. When I got to the checkout the cashier asked if I had a membership (had no idea they did membership here). I said no and that was it, nothing further other than the insane total. Apparently the "sale" items only apply to members but instead of the cashier saying anything or offer to see if I wanted a membership she clearly could care less and was ok charging me more than twice what items cost elsewhere simply because I was unaware I needed a membership to get the "sale" price. Maybe this is in fine print somewhere but definitely not anywhere apparent. And I thought the cashier would have at least said something about a membership rather than charging me double what I was expecting to pay. By the time I realized what happened she had already charged my card and I was so frustrated I just left. Will never be back here.
Very well stocked, it has lost its pizzazz over the years. It seems equivalent to Publix.
Really great produce and great friendly service!!!
Pretty good sales

I was the lone person standing at the counter during lunchtime while 4 workers scurried around behind it. Not one asked me what I needed. A Manager eventually breezed past and promised to send someone (rather than helping me herself?), and still no one materialized. As I exited empty handed, I told another manager of the non-existent service and all he could muster was "I'm sorry to hear that",  rather than taking any action himself.   It's like being in DMV.
Superior market, much more reasonable than Whole "Paycheck"
Great selection of Vegan items, a bit pricey
Nice but a little cramped. Friendly staff.

I just love their Take and Bake PIZZA better than ones you buy in pizza shops.

I like BOGO 16" Pepperoni Pizza Special for $10. On Saturdays and Sundays.

I remove the pepperoni and dress it up with Oregano, hot pepper, and dried onion flakes and pop it in a 400F oven until the cheese melts and crust starts browning.

Then remove and add onion, green pepper, chopped garlic and add back the pepperoni.

Bake until it bubbles and browns. The good part is the crust is so crispy. I can reheat any leftovers on a cast iron skillet until it heats through to the TOP and browns the crust so you can hold it and doesn't bend.

So good.  If you have a freezer in your garage, load up your freezer.
Love eating lunch here!

I love earth fare and the company but the staff here needs help. They are not very helpful nor friendly. I rather drive the extra 20 minutes to the next one just for better piece of mind and sevice. So so disappointing

For me they are the Whole Foods from the south, but with a cuter look ( in my opinion) and Nicer staff . Always very polite and helpful . I love that they have bulk items like oats and nuts .
Their meat is also good , even that I had one time a situation that I had to return since it was no good and they didn't made any fuss . Simply gave me the money back .
I also like that they have sushi here , it's from hissho sushi .
Lots of parking never too crowded.

We love this place! They have everything you can think of that is organic, vegan and earth friendly. We really like that they have an array of Zum products. Those are our favorite soaps. And now they're starting to carry different scents and the cut your own soap to size. Great place for all things earth friendly and if your a zum freak like me, that's where to get your zum products locally.
Got a ribeye here, far and away the least tasty ribeye I've ever had. Grass fed, tender but no flavor.
Best selection of organic produce and prices are fair.

I was there this afternoon during my lunch hour to get a salad from the salad bar. The young lady in front of me paid for her order with a credit card. But, while it was processing the young lady behind the counter walked away and started work on making something. We were just standing there waiting on her to return. Finally, the young lady asked for her change. Apparently she asked for cash back from her transaction. It was so frustrating because the woman working behind the counter didn't acknowledge that people were there waiting. And, she looked at the lady who asked for her change like she was crazy with no apology. When she gave her her change, she left the counter again and started working on making something else. I finally left to go to the front registers. As much as I like the salad bar, I will never be back. There are no many other choices.

I've been shopping here for 6 years and today I tried the signature sandwhich for the first time. Ive alwaysaloved thiststore but when  I say this sandwhich was the bomb, I mean it. All fresh, tastey, bread was delicious bagguette. I had the tuna signature and added tomatoes, onions, lettuce, olive oil and pepper flakes! Do it. Do it now and never go back to Subway! Neville made my sandwhich with love today, and I felt it!

I really love this store.  The produce is great.  Many many wine optionals.  They have a nice eating area with many smoothies available. The store is very clean.  I used to wax floors for a living, this store's floors are very well maintained.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  My wife and I enjoyed walking around and just looking.  But we still bought many great products.

Great place to get your organics and humane certified products. Employee was super nice even told me to help myself in trying some of the bulk products before I buy. Bought some organic bananas, organic baby carrots, organic half and half, organic avocados, and organic eggs. They also only use paper bags while bagging

Great lunch place, very quick to grab something healthy for the road or eat here. Really, I should get lunch there more often. Of course the are the best as a healthy place, but I work near by and just get that. Prices are not much more than Harris Teeter, and the quality is much better. They have this area like a coffee shop where you can eat.
Best cinnamon rolls in bakery case!

I have shopped at this store since its opening.  While expensive, I found items I could not find other places.  I also felt the customer service was good.  This is no longer the case.  It is still expensive, but I can now find most of what I used to buy here at other stores that are cleaner and have much better customer service.  The customer service here is nearly nonexistent, and the people who do the check out at the front are downright rude. I have had my items  (even glass containers) shoved and tossed down to the end - where it is expected that I always do my own bagging.  It isn't worth it to come here unless absolutely necessary.
Nice place
Gluck getting anyone to answer the phone
EXCELENTE lugar para comprar cosas naturales y frescas. Ami me gusto

I like the choices available here and knowing that the foods I buy here support humane treatment of animals and also good farming practices. I do find, though, that prices here are more expensive than other stores with the same items.
Great whole foods, fresh bakery, homesteaded creamery dairy, and healthy meals.

One of my favorite Grocery Stores around. Amazing company, staff, and facilities. Almost everything is organic. Peanut Butter bar, bulk foods, insane cheese selection, chocolate selection is also intense and mostly fair trade and organic. They have a plethora of vitamins and supplements and natural options for self care. The meat and seafood is so fresh. They have deals every Friday. So good. I highly recommend Earth Fare. I typically spend 45-90 min here. So much good stuff!
If you go every six months, you may get what you want. Otherwise you can expect all questions to be answered by someone who ate the glue. Glue Eaters welcome.
Tried this place a couple times.  Limited choices in food, and much pricier than other like stores.  I'd image more so with the changes with Amazon and Whole Foods.

This is literally the dumbest store I have ever been in. Some of the stuff is good, that's why it's two stars, but come on ORGANIC COFFE FILTERS and ORGANIC GLASS CLEANER and ORGANIC EXPENSIVE PET FOOD and ORGANIC PAPER TOWELS and ORGANIC DETERGENTS WITH PAPER FOR COVERING and the worst of all BAKING SODA AND BAKING POWDER. SERIOUSLY!!! This is the worst store ever and I only buy a few things here. Just go for the milk mac and cheese and orange juice.
It has a nice selection but you can get similar stuff in whole foods and harris teeter . This place is expensive
Organic food natural products with great redi made food to go.
Way overpriced!!!

Been shopping here for years, but the quality of their produce has been lacking (disappointing).  Example: bruised up apples, moldy blueberries, brown broccoli, and over ripe fruit.

The front entrance of the store is consistently dirty and often has an odor.  For example: the floor has trash and dirt (sometimes the same trash that was there the last time I visited) and carts are left sticky and dirty.  They are often out of hand wipes as well.

In addition, the customer service in the supplement/beauty area has been very poor.  One particular woman has been quite impatient and rude the last few times that I have approached her with questions, not to mention she lacked knowledge. In the past they have had some wonderful people working, but their customer service throughout the store has definitely declined. Unfortunate!
Good selection of organic foods

I am very dissapointed with the meat department here. They started a sale advertising sausage made in house starting friday through the weekend. I came a half an hour out of my way to be told it will take hours to case the sausage.  Is their a reason why this wasnt done before the sale started?  Like early morning before opening.. I was there at noon there should of been sausage already cased.. i can't take a chance to come back later in the day and just hope its done.  Very poor service to be told this.
Good store for all your health needs at a reasonable price
standoffish customers of other races, almost made me feel out of place.  selection is awesome however. staff st juice bar seemed like space cadets

Earthfare is a great place to shop for those avoiding GMOs, artificial colors and flavors, etc. Also, great place to pick up vitamins and homeopathic remedies! Parking lot is not super easy to get in and out of but still worth the stop.
Large selection of items, but pricey if you don't shop the sales.
I love that this is a grocery store option! They offer plenty of organic and/or nonGMO food options. They have a natural beauty, home products section. The have essential oils. Staff was friendly.
I'm always here. Love this place great- healthy food for the body!

Just a couple blocks from my job, which is convenient. Love going here for their Wednesday deals in the deli section. Wish their buffet was consistently good (some days better than others) but overall my favorite earthfare due to great service and always having the items I like in Stock.
Sanitation grade is not good.
Wonderful selection of products. Prices are a bit high on many items, but the loose-weight (bulk) grains are often the freshest and even cheapest of any place I know.
Best organic grocer in Charlotte
The staff is always friendly and they have a good selection of interesting products. I can't say it will ever replace my regular grocery store but it's a nice change of pace.
Really like this Earth Fare.  A good size store with a fresh produce department.  The pre-made food selection is pretty good when running late and not time to make dinner.
I had a red velvet cupcake from the bakery and it was very dry and the frosting was just okay. Definitely would not buy again.

You have a great location in a nice part of town and it's always dirty! Bathrooms are filthy and the juice bar employees are miserable. Went in last week and wanted to order a juice and there was a girl behind the counter and told me she was on break for another 5 minutes and I would have to wait.. Thanks I'll go to Whole Foods.
I love Earth Fare, but this location could use a little customer service training at their juice counter and front cashier area.

I like the store itself yes it's a bit pricey but the people that come to the store seem very rude that's one thing I do not like about the experience but it's not the stores fault its just the area in itself

I love this store.  It's one of the only ones I can shop at without having to analyzes labels for several hours making sure there are no JUNK ingredients.

I would highly recommend this store to anyone.

Also, if you have as many kids as we do (5)... kids eat FREE in their cafe on Thursday nights.
Great food, but you pay the high quality price for it. Sign up for their newsletter and get free coupons. Watch for sales and specials. Great selection!
